title: Hellblade II Dev on Xbox Future, Senua's Saga Launch - Kinda Funny Gamescast
description:
The Kinda Funny Membership gets you Ad-Free and Exclusive Shows: https://www.youtube.com/KindaFunnyGames/join
http://www.patreon.com/KindaFunny 

Ninja Theory Studio Head Dom Matthews joins Greg and Parris to talk about Senua’s Saga: Hellblade II with less than a week until launch! Let’s talk about the seven years between games, how this one took shape, and what Ninja Theory’s reaction to the Xbox closures last week was.

Time Stamps:
00:00:00 - Start
00:01:47 - Housekeeping
00:01:54 - An Interview w/ Dom Matthews from Ninja Theory
00:05:49 - How is Audio Improved?
00:07:26 - What Can We Expect from Gameplay?
00:09:58 - Handling Psychosis in a Story
00:11:14 - Working with Unreal Engine 5
00:12:57 - Announcing Hellblade 2 Along the Series X
00:15:51 - PC Specs
00:17:53 - How are You Feeling as a Studio?
00:21:24 - Difference Between Making 1 & 2
00:28:24 - Why Fallout 76 is Fun Now

of of sacrifice last week and the one thing that we pretty much agreed on was the comat that you know I thought it was okay it was good enough in in sacrifice but as we we go into Saga what can we expect from a combat standpoint are we going to see vast improvements there or because you know over the past few years people have been wanting to see more information about the game and combat has been the number one question so what can we expect from combat the big thing with combat in in Hell Bay 2 is that right at the beginning beginning of the project we wanted to focus on how can we make each of the combat combat encounters each of the battles feel like part of the overall story and part part of the narrative every time you face an enemy it's part of her Journey part of the narrative um the other big change I think is that uh in pursuit of making it feel as immersive and as visceral and as brutal as as possible uh everything every movement in the game is based in performance capture
